properties.code:
characters = arguments.get("candidates",[])


result["candidate_names"] = ", ".join([f'"{character.name}"' for character in characters])

groups.title: AI Function Calls to generate the auto direction

comments.text: there are only 2 active characters in the scene and no instructions are enabled in which case auto direct can just act as disabled and talemate will default back to the any other procedure of selecting the next character. (default - round robin)

Prepare some initial arguments. `characters` comes in as a list of available characters. It may also contain a '__narrator__' character to indicate that the narrator may be chosen for direction as well.

Determine whether the narrator is available for direction. To do this we check if the narrator proxy character (scene.narrator_character_object) is contained in the supplied candidates AND whether narrator instructions are ENABLED in the director agent's settings.
Remove the "__narrator__" proxy character from the list of candidates, which should only contain actual actor characters going forward.
The `instruct_narrator` variable is the final flag that decides whether or not the narrator will be an option for direction.

The AI called the `act` function.

Creates a dictionary containing the `character_name` of the chosen character and the `instructions` for the actor.

The AI called the `narrate_scene` function.

Creates a dictionary containing the `instructions` and the `action`. The latter will always be `narrate_scene`.

Assemble list of availalbe functions for the AI to use.

Whether the `act` function is available will depend on whether there are ANY available actor characters in the `characters` variable. (determined in previous stages) AND actor instruction is ENABLED.

Whether any of the narrator functions are available will depend on whether the `instruct_narrator` variable is TRUE. (determined in previous stages)

The AI called the `progress_story` function.

Creates a dictionary containing the `instructions` and the `action`. The latter wil always be `progress_story`.
Determine whether instructions of either actors or the narrator are enabled.
Auto direction is currently not possible if there is no user controlled actor in the scene.

Determine whether there are ANY characters available for direction. To do this we check that there is at least one actor candidate AND whether actor instructions are ENABLED in the director agent's settings.
The `instruct_actors` variable is the final flag that determines whether or not actor instructions will be available for the direction.
Run some python to join the list of candidates into a comma separated and quoted list of character names.

Prepare template variables to use for the AI function calling in the next stage.

Will create a dict with:

- `candidates` - list of available characters for direction
- `candidate_names` - formatted, comma separated list of candidate names
Call the available functions and route result into local variables based on what was called.
